item.description:
Fandango: Celebrating Mexican Son Jarocho Music
Saturday, August 28, 5-9 pm
rain date: Sunday, August 29
Union Square, Somerville

Organised by the Somerville Art Council this event is free and features 2 great bands: La Tuza and Radio Jarocho.

Fandangos are community celebrations that feature Son Jarocho music and dance, a genre from Veracruz, Mexico, which combines Afro-Caribbean, Spanish and indigenous traditions. Local band La Tuza will kick off Somerville's first Fandango; next up will be Brooklyn-based Radio Jarocho (above). There will also be dance lessons and performances, Mexican food, art activities and a short film about the Son Jarocho tradition. The Fandango will end as both bands play together and other local musicians join in. Ol√©, we say. Produced by SAC.

More info here
item.name: Fandango: Celebrating Mexican Son Jarocho Music
